============
Contributing
============

Contributing to **mudu**
""""""""""""""""""""""""

Thanks you for considering to contribte to this project, it is really appreciated.

We welcome contribution in the following (but not limited to) aspects:

- Bug fixes
- Code improvement and optimizations
- Documentations and Tutorials
- Issue reporting and feature requests

How To Contribute
"""""""""""""""""

1. Fork the project repository at `<https://github.com/techkaduna/mudu>_`
2. Create a new branck for your code
3. Make changes
4. Write (or update) tests where neccesary
5. Commit your changes with intuitive an commit message
6. Open a pull request with a breif and concise explantion about your change(s)

Coding guideline
""""""""""""""""

- Follow PEP8 style guidelines
- Use desciptive commit messages
- Write beautiful Numpy/Scipy style docstrings

Testing
"""""""

mudu uses `pytest` for testing. Run `pytest` locally and make sure all tests are passed before submitting pull request.

Once again, thanks for trying to make mudu better.
